info.name: EndToEndRequestTest
info.description: This test is an example of an end to end set of API requests to submit a roster and export patient data. Each element in the 'item' list is a single request.

These organizations are normally created by the DPC team and are pre-existing.

request.description: While the export request is being processed, the job url will return a 202 status. When it is completed, a 200 status will be returned, along with JSON containing the patient, explanation of benefits, and coverage data.
The patient data url comes from the response to the job in the previous request. It is in ndjson, which is a set of JSON responses, one per line. Each line contains the JSON data for one patient.

exec: // There should be 86 Explanations of Benefits.

request.description: The explanation of benefits data url comes from the response to the job in the previous request. It is in ndjson, which is a set of JSON responses, one per line. Each line contains the JSON data for one explanation of benefits.
The coverage data url comes from the response to the job in the previous request. It is in ndjson, which is a set of JSON responses, one per line. Each line contains the JSON data for one coverage.
